intro: Rhynchospora binervis, commonly known as the two-veined spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. Rhynchospora binervis is characterized by its two distinct veins on the leaf blades, which give it its common name. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
